meanings.meaning: 1. direction; way; side; area (in a particular direction)
2. side (of an argument, etc.); one's part often 私の方, あなたの方, etc.
3. type; category
4. field (of study, etc.)
5. indicates one side of a comparison
6. way; method; manner; means
7. length (of each side of a square)
1. direction; way also ほう

2. person; lady; gentleman Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) languageグリーン夫人は、私の子供たちが歌を習っている方ですが、今度の日曜に独唱会を開く予定です。Mrs. Green, from whom my children have lessons in singing, is to have a recital next Sunday.

meanings.type: Noun, Noun, used as a suffix
meanings.meaning: 3. method of; manner of; way of その少年はカーブの投げ方を知っている。The boy knows how to throw a curve.
4. care of ...
5. person in charge of ... also がた
6. side (e.g. "on my mother's side") also がた
1. Sirs; Mesdames Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) language, pluralizing suffix
2. around (the time that, etc.); about also かた
1. direction; way; side; area (in a particular direction)
2. side (of an argument, etc.); one's part often 私の方, あなたの方, etc.

1. Mr; Mrs; Miss; Ms Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) language, after a person's name, position, etc.彼女は王女様になった夢を見た。She dreamed that she was a princess.
2. makes a word more polite (usu. in fixed expressions) Polite (teineigo) language, See also お粗末さまでした, usu. after a noun or na-adjective prefixed with お or ごどうもご親切さま。That's very kind of you.
3. state; situation; appearance; manner フラフラと歩き回る様は、あまりにデンジャラスだ。The way she dizzily moves around is far too dangerous.
方 【さま】、状 【さま】
方: Rarely-used kanji form. 状: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: She dreamed that she was a princess.
That's very kind of you.
The way she dizzily moves around is far too dangerous.

方が良い 【ほうがいい】、ほうが良い 【ほうがいい】、方が良い 【ほうがよい】、ほうが良い 【ほうがよい】、方がよい 【ほうがよい】

1. you Usually written using kana alone, trad. polite in ref. to someone of equal or lower status, now oft. regarded as rude or distant毎晩十分な睡眠をとれば、あなたはずっと気分がよくなるだろう。If you get enough rest every night, you'll feel much better.
2. dear; honey Familiar language, Usually written using kana alone, Only applies to 貴方, Only applies to 貴男, used by wives addressing their husbandsねえあなたたち行かないで。Don't go, dears.
貴女 【あなた】、貴男 【あなた】

sentences.translation: If you get enough rest every night, you'll feel much better.
Don't go, dears.

meanings.meaning: 1. early evening (usu. from 3pm to 6pm); dusk
夕がた 【ゆうがた】
1. who Usually written using kana alone, Honorific or respectful (sonkeigo) language

1. this way; this direction Usually written using kana alone, See also そちら, See also あちら, See also どちら, direction close to the speaker or towards the speakerこちらへやってくる少年とその犬をごらんなさい。Look at the boy and his dog that are coming this way.
2. here Usually written using kana alone, place close to the speaker or where the speaker is塩をこちらへ取ってもらえますか。Could you pass me the salt, please?
3. this (one) Usually written using kana alone, something physically close to the speakerこちらの方があちらより値段が高い。This costs more than that.
4. I; me; we; us Usually written using kana aloneこちらアヤ、こちらアヤ、応答お願いします。This is Aya, this is Aya. Please respond.
5. this person Usually written using kana alone, Only applies to こちら, someone physically close to the speaker and of equal or higher status叔母さん、こちらはトム君です。Aunt, this is Tom.
此方 【こっち】、此方 【こち】
此方: Rarely-used kanji form. 此方: Rarely-used kanji form. こち: Out-dated or obsolete kana usage. 此方: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Look at the boy and his dog that are coming this way.
Could you pass me the salt, please?
This costs more than that.
This is Aya, this is Aya. Please respond.
Aunt, this is Tom.

meanings.meaning: 1. that way; that direction Usually written using kana alone, See also こちら, See also あちら, See also どちら, direction distant from the speaker, close to the listenerそちらはセントラル自動車学校ではないんですか。Isn't this Central Driving School?
2. there Usually written using kana alone, place distant from the speaker, close to the listenerそっちの生活はどうだい？How are things for you up there?
3. that (one) Usually written using kana alone, something close to the listenerこれとそちらとの違いは何だい。What is the difference between this and that?
4. you; your family; your company Usually written using kana alone, そちら is politeそちらの条件を受け入れましょう。We will accept your conditions.
5. that person Usually written using kana alone, someone close to the listener
其方 【そっち】、其方 【そなた】、其方 【そち】
其方: Rarely-used kanji form. 其方: Rarely-used kanji form. 其方: Rarely-used kanji form. 其方: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Isn't this Central Driving School?
How are things for you up there?
What is the difference between this and that?
We will accept your conditions.

meanings.meaning: 1. both; both sides; both parties See also 片方
1. district; region; area; locality 彼は今年の夏、東北地方を旅行した。He traveled through the Tohoku district this summer.
2. the country; countryside; the provinces; rural area See also 中央その地方は大規模に開発されるだろう。It seems the rural area will be developed on a large scale.
3. civilian society Obsolete term, Imperial Japanese Army jargon
4. Jikata

sentences.translation: He traveled through the Tohoku district this summer.
It seems the rural area will be developed on a large scale.

meanings.meaning: 1. one (esp. of two); the other; one way; the other way; one direction; the other direction; one side; the other side; one party; the other party 床は緑色に塗られていたが、一方壁は黄色だった。The floor was painted green, while the walls were yellow.
2. on the one hand; on the other hand See also 他方しかし、その一方、ラテン語はそのときまでに「死語」となっていた。But, then again, Latin was already a "dead language" by that time.
3. whereas; although; but at the same time; meanwhile; in turn

meanings.type: Noun, Noun, used as a suffix, Adverb (fukushi)
meanings.meaning: 4. just keeps; being inclined to ...; tending to be ...; tending to do ...; continuously ...; just keeps on ...ing; only after noun, adjective-stem or plain verb本屋で英語関係の本を見つけると、次々に買ってしまって、読まずにいるので、たまる一方です。I always buy the English-language books I come across at bookstores. But since I never read them, all they do is pile up.
5. Ippou

sentences.translation: The floor was painted green, while the walls were yellow.
But, then again, Latin was already a "dead language" by that time.
I always buy the English-language books I come across at bookstores. But since I never read them, all they do is pile up.
